intro: Ochlopoa rivulorum, commonly known as the river sedge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or riparian habitats, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. Ochlopoa rivulorum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
